content: Jenny formalizes the 168‑Hour Architecture to disambiguate weekly time: start with sleep (56h), then school (≈37.5h), then transit (≈4.5h), leaving ≈70h to allocate across core lanes (e.g., Game Dev 7h, Women in AI 3h, VFX Club 2h, SAT 5h, Applications 2h, YouTube 4h). This framing makes tradeoffs explicit and prevents “phantom bandwidth” planning. [Source: EXEC Part 1 – Frameworks & Tools].
insight_vector: 168‑Hour Architecture: sleep-first accounting; ~70h usable; explicit lane allocations to prevent phantom bandwidth

content: Letter-of-Rec Conversation Script handed verbatim: greet, identity, curiosity cue, excitement for class, then 4-step follow‑through (speak once per class, introduce after class, make 1–2 new friends, book counselor meeting week one). Removes ambiguity and accelerates teacher rapport. [Source: EXEC Part 1 – Frameworks & Tools].
insight_vector: Exact LOR conversation script + 4-step follow-through to accelerate recommender rapport

content: Reusable cold‑email template decomposition: Introduction (role/identity) → Personal details (credibility) → Specific ask → Gratitude/next step. Provided counselor draft usable across >10 outreach cases. [Source: EXEC Part 1 – Frameworks & Tools].
insight_vector: Reusable cold-email template: intro → credibility → ask → close; generalized to 10+ outreach cases

content: NCWIT Essay Architecture: four prompts framed as diagnostic questions (spark; track record; future; problem‑solving). Jenny supplies bullets instead of prose to force student narrative authorship and avoid voice contamination. [Source: EXEC Part 1 – Frameworks & Tools].
insight_vector: NCWIT essay framework (spark/doing/future/problem solving); bullet seeding to preserve student voice

content: Strategic Overwhelm Calibration: over‑assign slightly (expect ~70% completion), never punish incompletion, always celebrate the done slice. Establishes sustainable momentum while increasing ceiling over time. [Source: EXEC Part 1 – Frameworks & Tools].
insight_vector: Over-assign with ~70% completion target; celebrate progress to sustain velocity and raise ceiling

content: Empowering AI org blueprint: national team lanes (curriculum; outreach; website), event differentiation (hands‑on workshops, hackathon, conference), and a 4‑meeting AI Ethics toolkit (CS/Python → AI basics → build something → ethics). Built live in-session. [Source: EXEC Part 1 – Frameworks & Tools].
insight_vector: Nonprofit blueprint: national lanes + event mix + 4‑meeting AI ethics toolkit; designed live

content: Profile Trinity Architecture: Aptitude × Passion × Service as three mutually reinforcing pillars (e.g., CS/AI aptitude → awards; Games/Film passion → programs; Education/Culture service → 600+ hrs). Aligns selection and deepening of activities. [Source: 15 Outcome‑Driven Frameworks].
insight_vector: Aptitude × Passion × Service triad; choose activities that mutually reinforce across pillars

content: 10 EC Optimization: fill all Common App slots with role‑engineered mix—2–3 flagship (400+ hrs), 3–4 supporting (100–200 hrs), 2–3 validation programs, 2 service commitments. Optimize character counts from vague to quantified impact. [Source: 15 Outcome‑Driven Frameworks].
insight_vector: Common App 10‑slot optimization: flagship/supporting/validation/service + quantified descriptions

content: Impact Scaling Hierarchy: prioritize real users over perfect product; escalate evidence ladder—built → used → measurable impact → media coverage. Operational push: ship to classrooms early, then scale. [Source: 15 Outcome‑Driven Frameworks].
insight_vector: Impact hierarchy: built→used→impact→media; ship early and scale with real users

content: Award Arbitrage System: select awards by alignment, odds (<5k applicants), prestige, and essay‑reuse ROI. Portfolio includes NCWIT, Games for Change, regional/rural awards, AP Scholar. [Source: 15 Outcome‑Driven Frameworks].
insight_vector: Award selection matrix (alignment, odds, prestige, essay‑reuse) to maximize wins per effort

content: Hours‑Per‑Week Reality Check: 168−56 (sleep)−37.5 (school)=74.5 available; test claimed hours (e.g., 8h/wk × 50wks = 400h) against reality to avoid over‑reporting. [Source: 15 Outcome‑Driven Frameworks].
insight_vector: Reality test claimed activity hours against 74.5 weekly availability to ensure truthful reporting

content: Leadership Title Engineering: prioritize Founder > President > VP; National > Regional > School. Elevate roles where authentic (e.g., founder across 3 orgs; national ambassador program). [Source: 15 Outcome‑Driven Frameworks].
insight_vector: Engineer role hierarchy authentically (Founder/National preferred) to strengthen EC narrative

content: Narrative Coherence: unify all ECs under a single identity (e.g., ‘interactive media storyteller’ via games, film, journalism, and teaching). Ensures every activity advances one story. [Source: 15 Outcome‑Driven Frameworks].
insight_vector: Unify ECs under one identity; every activity advances the same story

content: Metric Ladder for outcomes: hours → users → beneficiaries → dollars raised → media mentions. Used to set targets and track compounding credibility. [Source: 15 Outcome‑Driven Frameworks].
insight_vector: Metric ladder: hours→users→beneficiaries→$→media to compound credibility

content: Extracurricular Validation Proof: conversion of projects to quantifiable outcomes (e.g., 6400 students reached across 200 classrooms; 5 national awards). Documents before→after deltas to substantiate claims. [Source: EC Validation Proof].
insight_vector: EC validation: 200 classrooms/6400 students; 5 national awards; documented before→after deltas

content: Portfolio Operating Cadence: weekly planning doc drives task disambiguation, checkbox execution, and reflective adjustments; integrates program applications, outreach, content production, and academics under one cadence. [Source: Actual Tactics].
insight_vector: Weekly planning + checkbox execution + reflection forms the operating cadence across lanes
